alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:50AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt has been slowing the past few days and water levels on Pacific Creek near Moran have been on a similar slow decline. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Pacific Creek near Moran. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor low level flooding along lower banks. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of upstream USFS campground on right bank. Minor lowland flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Sunday, May 28 the stage was hovering around 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around action stage for the next few days with nightly peak flows occurring between midnight and 3 AM. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
